page.title: 16TORRYBURN BYPASS
page.content: {The Torryburn Bypass runs to the north {of the villages of Torryburn, Newmills {and High Valleyfield and takes the {majority of the traffic away from {these villages. The road has a bad reputation in the area in that many accidents have occurred on that stretch of road, possibly because it is a fairly straight road, but is not of a standard of a motorway. In 1983 a five year old High Valleyfield boy was killed on the Bypass. St Serfs Primary School now have a trophy_{The Mark Beveridge {Trophy}awarded for general excellence} in P7. In recent months{barriers}have} been erected at the roadside behind High Valleyfield near the Bluther Bridge.
